revised_title: Edward Haistwell: The Quaker and Fellow of the Royal Society
tldr: This article discusses the life of Edward Haistwell, who served as an amanuensis for George Fox, the founder of the Quaker movement, and was later elected as a Fellow of the Royal Society. It explores the connection between the two Edward Haistwells and provides a brief account of his life, including his work with Fox, his involvement in the Quaker community, and his time as a member of the Royal Society.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History
